metadata.title: CVE-2019-25162 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: i2c:Fix a potential use after free Free the adap structure only after we aredone using it. This patch just moves the put_device() down a bit to avoidthe use after free. [wsa: added comment to the code, added Fixes tag]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-25162` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-197.208
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-197.208
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-197.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-197.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-197.208
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-132.148~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-132.148~18.04.1
